context: Four boys—Fred, Juan, Marc, and Paul—and three girls—Nita, Rachel, and Trisha—will be assigned to a row of five adjacent lockers, numbered consecutively 1 through 5, arranged along a straight wall. The following conditions govern the assignment of lockers to the seven children: Each locker must be assigned to either one or two children, and each child must be assigned to exactly one locker. Each shared locker must be assigned to one girl and one boy. Juan must share a locker, but Rachel cannot share a locker. Nita's locker cannot be adjacent to Trisha's locker. Fred must be assigned to locker 3.
question: Which one of the following is a complete and accurate list of the children who must be among those assigned to shared lockers?
options: A) Fred, Juan
B) Juan, Paul
C) Juan, Marc, Paul
D) Juan, Marc, Trisha
E) Juan, Nita, Trisha
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
children = EnumSort([Fred, Juan, Marc, Nita, Paul, Rachel, Trisha])
lockers = EnumSort([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
assigned = Function([children, lockers] -> [bool])
ForAll([c:children], And(assigned(c, lockers(c)), Count([l:lockers], assigned(c, l)) == 1)) ::: each child must be assigned to exactly one locker
ForAll([l:lockers], Count([c:children], And(assigned(c, l), Or(c == Nita, c == Juan))) == 2) ::: each shared locker must be assigned to one girl and one boy
And(assigned(Juan, lockers(Juan)), Not(assigned(Rachel, lockers(Juan)))) ::: Juan must share a locker, but Rachel cannot share a locker
assigned(Nita, lockers(Nita)) ->: Not(assigned(Trisha, lockers(Nita))) ::: Nita's locker cannot be adjacent to Trisha's locker
assigned(Fred, lockers(3)) ::: Fred must be assigned to locker 3

# Options
Question ::: ::: Which one of the following is a complete and accurate list of the children who must be among those assigned to shared lockers?
is_sat(Or(assigned(Fred, lockers(1)), assigned(Juan, lockers(1)))) ::: (A)
is_sat(Or(assigned(Juan, lockers(1)), assigned(Paul, lockers(1)))) ::: (B)
is_sat(Or(assigned(Juan, lockers(1)), assigned(Marc, lockers(1)), assigned(Paul, lockers(1)))) ::: (C)
is_sat(Or(assigned(Juan, lockers(1)), assigned(Marc, lockers(1)), assigned(Trisha, lockers(1)))) ::: (D)
is_sat(Or(assigned(Juan, lockers(1)), assigned(Nita, lockers(1)), assigned(Trisha, lockers(1)))) ::: (E)

question: Which one of the following could be the order in which the programs are shown, from earliest to latest?

B) Roamin', Sundown, Waterloo, Terry, Generations

D) Waterloo, Roamin', Sundown, Terry, Generations
E) Waterloo, Terry, Sundown, Roamin', Generations

programs = EnumSort([Generations, Roamin', Sundown, Terry, Waterloo])
shown = Function([programs] -> [int])
ForAll([p:programs], And(1 <= shown(p), shown(p) <= 3))

# Constraints
shown(Generations) == 1 ::: Generations starts on the hour rather than the half hour
shown(Terry) == 2 ::: Terry starts on the half hour rather than the hour
shown(Roamin') < shown(Sundown) ::: Roamin' is shown earlier than Sundown

is_sat(And(shown(Roamin') == 1, shown(Sundown) == 2, shown(Waterloo) == 3, shown(Terry) == 4, shown(Generations) == 5)) ::: (B)
is_sat(And(shown(Roamin') == 1, shown(Terry) == 2, shown(Waterloo) == 3, shown(Generations) == 4, shown(Sundown) == 5)) ::: (C)
is_sat(And(shown(Waterloo) == 1, shown(Roamin') == 2, shown(Sundown) == 3, shown(Terry) == 4, shown(Generations) == 5)) ::: (D)
is_sat(And(shown(Waterloo) == 1, shown(Terry) == 2, shown(Sundown) == 3, shown(Roamin') == 4, shown(Generations) == 5)) ::: (E)

context: At a business symposium there will be exactly five speakers: Long, Molina, Xiao, Yoshida, and Zimmerman. Each speaker will give exactly one speech, in either the Gold Room or the Rose Room. In each room, there will be exactly one speech at 1 P.M. and one speech at 2 P.M. In one of the rooms, yet to be determined, there will also be a speech at 3 P.M. The schedule of speeches is constrained by the following: Molina's speech must be earlier than Long's, and in the same room. Neither Xiao's speech nor Yoshida's speech can be earlier than Zimmerman's. If Long's speech is in the Gold Room, then Xiao's and Zimmerman's speeches must both be in the Rose Room.
question: Which one of the following, if substituted for the constraint that neither Xiao's speech nor Yoshida's speech can be earlier than Zimmerman's, would have the same effect in determining the schedule of speeches with regard to rooms and times?
options: A) Long's speech must be at 3 P.M.
B) Molina's speech cannot be earlier than Zimmerman's.
C) Either Xiao's speech or Yoshida's speech must be after Zimmerman's.
D) Either Xiao's speech or Yoshida's speech or both must be at 2 P.M.
E) Zimmerman's speech must be at 1 P.M.
raw_logic_programs:
# Declarations
speakers = EnumSort([Long, Molina, Xiao, Yoshida, Zimmerman])
speeches = EnumSort([Long_speech, Molina_speech, Xiao_speech, Yoshida_speech, Zimmerman_speech])
rooms = EnumSort([Gold_Room, Rose_Room])
times = EnumSort([one_P_M, two_P_M, three_P_M])
gives = Function([speakers, speeches] -> [rooms])
at = Function([speeches, times] -> [bool])

# Constraints
ForAll([s:speeches], And(at(s), Count([t:times], at(s)) == 1)) ::: in each room, there will be exactly one speech at 1 P.M. and one speech at 2 P.M.
ForAll([r:rooms], Count([s:speeches], And(at(s), gives(s, r))) == 1) ::: in one of the rooms, yet to be determined, there will also be a speech at 3 P.M.
And(gives(Molina, Gold_Room), at(Long_speech), at(Molina_speech), at(Long_speech) < at(Molina_speech)) ::: Molina's speech must be earlier than Long's, and in the same room
ForAll([s:speeches], Implies(gives(s, Gold_Room), Or(gives(Xiao_speech, Rose_Room), gives(Zimmerman_speech, Rose_Room)))) ::: if Long's speech is in the Gold Room, then Xiao's and Zimmerman's speeches must both be in the Rose Room
ForAll([s:speeches], Implies(at(s), Not(at(Zimmerman_speech)))) ::: neither Xiao's speech nor Yoshida's speech can be earlier than Zimmerman's

# Options
Question ::: ::: Which one of the following, if substituted for the constraint that neither Xiao's speech nor Yoshida's speech can be earlier than Zimmerman's, would have the same effect in determining the schedule of speeches with regard to rooms and times?
is_valid(ForAll([s:speeches], at(s) == at(Zimmerman_speech))) ::: (A)
is_valid(ForAll([s:speeches], Implies(at(s), at(Zimmerman_speech)))) ::: (B)
is_valid(ForAll([s:speeches], Or(at(s), at(Zimmerman_speech)))) ::: (C)
is_valid(ForAll([s:speeches], Or(at(s), at(Zimmerman_speech), at(Xiao_speech), at(Yoshida_speech)))) ::: (D)
is_valid(ForAll([s:speeches], Implies(at(s), at(Zimmerman_speech)))) ::: (E)

E) Trents: the stable Williamses: the inn, the mill Yandells: the forge, the granary

Problem:
In a class of eight students—Lena, Moe, Nella, Omar, Pablo, Quincy, Roxie, and Sasha—each student’s last name is the same as one and only one of the following eight letters: L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, or S. The students are seated in the eight seats of a circle so that each sits in a different seat, and each sits next to at least one other student whose last name is the same letter as his or her own. The seating is also arranged so that the following conditions are met: Quincy is seated next to Lena. Sasha is not seated next to Quincy. Roxie is not seated next to Nella. Pablo is seated next to Omar.
Moe is seated between whom?
Choices:
(A) Lena and Omar
(B) Nella and Omar
(C) Omar and Pablo
(D) Pablo and Quincy
(E) Roxie and Sasha
"""
# Declarations
students = EnumSort([Lena, Moe, Nella, Omar, Pablo, Quincy, Roxie, Sasha])
last_names = EnumSort([L, M, N, O, P, Q, R, S])
sits_next_to = Function([students, students] -> [bool])
ForAll([s:students], And(1 <= sits_next_to(s, s), sits_next_to(s, s) <= 8)) ::: each sits next to at least one other student whose last name is the same letter as his or her own
ForAll([s:students], Implies(sits_next_to(s, s), last_names(s) == last_names(sits_next_to(s, s)))) ::: each sits next to at least one other student whose last name is the same letter as his or her own

# Constraints
sits_next_to(Quincy, Lena) ::: Quincy is seated next to Lena
Not(sits_next_to(Sasha, Quincy)) ::: Sasha is not seated next to Quincy
Not(sits_next_to(Roxie, Nella)) ::: Roxie is not seated next to Nella
sits_next_to(Pablo, Omar) ::: Pablo is seated next to Omar
sits_next_to(Moe, _) ::
